reviewText:
[Production quality issue] It's great to save some money on multi-movie sets. I try to do it all the time, but this one isn't worth it.
All the movies present decent stories, but half of them have really lousy audio and video quality, and none of the movies offer subtitles to help.
***And here's one interesting example of deceptive advertising...***
Minesweeper, "Starring" Robert Mitchum -- I like Robert Mitchum and was looking forward to seeing him in one of a handful of WW2 movies I hadn't seen yet. It was one of the reasons I bought this set. Well, he was un-credited in the credits, recognizable in only a few group scenes, and never uttered a word. The DVD case said, "Seaman Chuck Ryan (Robert Mitchum) adds to the drama in this adventure film." Yeah, he was blown up by a mine halfway through the movie. And this was one of the movies with bad A/V quality. From IMDB: The failure of the original copyright holder to renew the film's copyright resulted in it falling into public domain, meaning that virtually anyone could duplicate and sell a VHS/DVD copy of the film. Therefore, many of the versions of this film available on the market are either severely (and usually badly) edited and/or of extremely poor quality, having been duped from second- or third-generation (or more) copies of the film.
[The set came with one broken case too :( ]
